results.firPara: A fine save by Rui Patricio from Jakub Blaszczykowskis penalty allowed Ricardo Quaresma to strike the decisive kick in the shootout that took Portugal into the semi-finals
results.secPara: A fine save by Rui Patricio from Jakub Blaszczykowskis penalty allowed Ricardo Quaresma to strike the decisive kick in the shootout that took Portugal into the semi-finals
results.webTitle: Portugal beat Poland on penalties to reach the semi-finals – as it happened!

results.firPara: Watford have turned down a £38m offer for their striker Odion Ighalo from the free-spending Shanghai SIPG. The Chinese club broke their transfer record this week when they signed Hulk from Zenit St Petersburg for £46.1m but they are unlikely to add Ighalo to their squad after Watfords refusal to even consider the offer.
results.secPara: Ighalo scored 17 goals in 42 appearances last season and has been linked with a move away from the club but the owner, Giampaolo Pozzo, is not considering selling the striker.
results.webTitle: Watford turn down £38m Shanghai SIPG offer for Odion Ighalo

results.firPara: USA will play Cuba in Havana in October – the US mens national teams first visit since President Obama announced a thawing of US-Cuba relations.
results.secPara: US Soccer confirmed the friendly match, to be played on 7 October, on Thursday. In 2014, Barack Obama began to restore full relations between the US and Cuba, after more than 50 years of hostility between the two countries.
results.webTitle: US men's national team to travel to Cuba for historic friendly in October

results.firPara: There are not many players, in a world where some clubs now attempt to exert control over individuals social media accounts, that could announce their own transfer online before their new team, but Zlatan Ibrahimovic is not your average footballer. In the 34-year-old Manchester United have acquired not just one of the modern‑day great strikers, but also one of the all‑time great personalities.
results.secPara: Ibrahimovic seems to have a killer one-liner to match every killer goal, but that outspokenness and penchant for controversy has often threatened to cast a shadow over his success as a player.
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic: the ego lands and eyes fairytale end at Manchester United

results.firPara: • The pressures on us to keep performing, and thats what we want to do
results.secPara: • The pressures on us to keep performing, and thats what we want to do
results.webTitle: Chris Coleman insists Euro 2016 quarter-final not the limit for Wales

results.firPara: Josep Maria Bartomeu, the Barcelona president, is confident that Neymar will sign a contract extension to stay at Camp Nou despite interest from Manchester United and Paris Saint-Germain in the Brazil forward.
results.secPara: United and PSG have both been linked with a move for the Neymar, who has two years left on his contract. But Bartomeu insisted on Thursday that the forward, 24, has committed his future to the Spanish champions and will sign a five-year deal.
results.webTitle: Barcelona expect Neymar to sign five-year deal ‘in next few days’

results.firPara: • José Mourinho a fan of the France midfielder
results.secPara: Manchester United are stepping up their efforts to sign Paul Pogba from Juventus after Zlatan Ibrahimovic confirmed he was heading to Old Trafford. Ibrahimovic will arrive on Friday to sign a one-year contract to work with José Mourinho again.
results.webTitle: Manchester United chasing £65m Paul Pogba after Zlatan Ibrahimovic capture

results.firPara: In todays Fiver the Euro 2016 quarter-finals! Plus Sisqo and swimming
results.secPara: In todays Fiver the Euro 2016 quarter-finals! Plus Sisqo and swimming
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Counting the diamonds around sinks in other people’s homes

results.firPara: Crystal Palace are set to complete the signing of Andros Townsend from Newcastle United within the next 48 hours after triggering a £13m release clause in the England wingers contract.
results.secPara: Townsend, who was one of the three players omitted by Roy Hodgson from his initial 26-man squad for the European Championship, had been made aware of Palaces interest in restoring him to the Premier League this month but asked for time to consider the move back to London. A number of other clubs retained an interest, including Southampton and West Ham, but the 24-year-old has returned from holiday and expressed a desire to move to Selhurst Park. He will be given a four-year contract and becomes Palaces record signing.
results.webTitle: Crystal Palace set to sign Andros Townsend from Newcastle for £13m

results.firPara: Patrice Evra has urged his France team-mates to wake up and be wary of the threat posed by Iceland in the quarter-final at the Stade de France on Sunday after admitting his sides happy knack of scoring late goals will not last for ever.
results.secPara: France have required late rallies to see off Romania and Albania and had to come from a goal down to beat Republic of Ireland ,but they still go into the match as the overwhelming favourites. Evra admitted his surprise that Iceland had beaten England and is wary of falling into the trap of underestimating the team ranked 34th in the world.
results.webTitle: Patrice Evra says France cannot afford another ‘crazy’ start against Iceland
